main_text:
Eliminative materialism (or eliminativism) is the radical
claim that our ordinary, common-sense understanding of the mind is
deeply wrong and that some or all of the mental states posited by
common-sense do not actually exist and have no role to play in a
mature science of the mind. Descartes famously challenged much of what
we take for granted, but he insisted that, for the most part, we can
be confident about the content of our own minds. Eliminative
materialists go further than Descartes on this point, since they
challenge the existence of various mental states that Descartes took
for granted.
